html: Today is the 54th anniversary of Bloody Sunday, when nonviolent civil rights activists- including my friend @RepJohnLewis- marched from Selma to Montgomery before being attacked, bloodied, and arrested. Their courage and sacrifice paved the way for the Voting Rights Act.pic.twitter.com/QHuGhame8m
text:
Today is the 54th anniversary of Bloody Sunday, when nonviolent civil rights activists- including my friend @RepJohnLewis- marched from Selma to Montgomery before being attacked, bloodied, and arrested.

Things that are not a national emergency:

html: The Senate is expected to vote today to make Thomas Farr a federal judge in North Carolina. Who is Thomas Farr? For starters, he was a lawyer for then-Senator Jesse Helms’ campaign, where he defended the campaign in its efforts to disenfranchise African American voters.
text:
The Senate is expected to vote today to make Thomas Farr a federal judge in North Carolina.

Who is Thomas Farr? For starters, he was a lawyer for then-Senator Jesse Helms’ campaign, where he defended the campaign in its efforts to disenfranchise African American voters.

html: As early as Friday, residents in 27 counties impacted by #HurricaneFlorence (including Wilson County and Pitt County) can apply for help buying food through the Disaster Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, or “D-SNAP.” More info: https://www.ncdhhs.gov/hurricane-florence-d-snap-locations …
text:
As early as Friday, residents in 27 counties impacted by #HurricaneFlorence (including Wilson County and Pitt County) can apply for help buying food through the Disaster Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, or “D-SNAP.”

More info: https://www.ncdhhs.gov/hurricane-florence-d-snap-locations …

text: Instead of trying to make healthcare less affordable for 130 million Americans, we should be working together to strengthen the ACA, lower premiums, and deliver quality affordable healthcare for every American.

html: Without the ACA's protections for pre-existing conditions, insurance companies will again be able to deny coverage or charge higher premiums for things like high blood pressure, mental illness, or being a woman.

I oppose this nomination, and I urge my colleagues in the Senate to #StopKavanaugh.

html: I have vivid recollections of the 1963 March on Washington. A hot August day with thousands of people lining the streets with signs and joining hands for a common purpose. As we remember this day in 1963, we do not just celebrate this history- we commemorate it.
text: I have vivid recollections of the 1963 March on Washington. A hot August day with thousands of people lining the streets with signs and joining hands for a common purpose. As we remember this day in 1963, we do not just celebrate this history- we commemorate it.

html: Today marks the 55th anniversary of the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom and Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s "I Have a Dream" speech. I was 16 years old when I marched with my father and 250,000 Americans of all backgrounds at the Lincoln Memorial.pic.twitter.com/k2pxQIgmEn
text: Today marks the 55th anniversary of the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom and Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s "I Have a Dream" speech. I was 16 years old when I marched with my father and 250,000 Americans of all backgrounds at the Lincoln Memorial.pic.twitter.com/k2pxQIgmEn

html: Schools need new technology, more money for art & STEM classes, & stronger mental health services for students. They don't need guns. Today, I, along with 172 @HouseDemocrats called on Sec. DeVos to prohibit federal education money from being spent on firearms. #BuyBooksNotGuns
text:
Schools need new technology, more money for art & STEM classes, & stronger mental health services for students. They don't need guns. 

Today, I, along with 172 @HouseDemocrats called on Sec. DeVos to prohibit federal education money from being spent on firearms. #BuyBooksNotGuns

html: American workers deserve a raise. I’m proud to be a cosponsor of the Raise the Wage Act which gradually increases the hourly federal minimum wage from $7.25 to $15 by 2024 which will help reduce income inequality, increase consumer demand, & strengthen the economy for all.
text: American workers deserve a raise. I’m proud to be a cosponsor of the Raise the Wage Act which gradually increases the hourly federal minimum wage from $7.25 to $15 by 2024 which will help reduce income inequality, increase consumer demand, & strengthen the economy for all.

html: There’s an easy way to improve the lives of millions of Americans: raise the federal minimum wage. 9 years ago today was the last time Congress raised the minimum wage (when @NancyPelosi was speaker). $7.25 is not a living wage in 2018, but thats what millions of Americans make
text:
There’s an easy way to improve the lives of millions of Americans: raise the federal minimum wage.

html: Good news! My bill to name #Durham's federal courthouse as the "John Hervey Wheeler United States Courthouse" passed the House on Monday. John Hervey Wheeler was one of our state’s most prominent Black leaders & one of the most influential civil rights figures in the South.pic.twitter.com/HFk1botLYc
text:
Good news! My bill to name #Durham's federal courthouse as the "John Hervey Wheeler United States Courthouse" passed the House on Monday.  

John Hervey Wheeler was one of our state’s most prominent Black leaders & one of the most influential civil rights figures in the South.pic.twitter.com/HFk1botLYc

html: Tomorrow marks the 53rd anniversary of the Older Americans Act. If you are an older American, you have likely been positively impacted by the Act. The #OAA supports nutrition services, health programs, & more for millions over 65. As #OAAturns53, we must work to keep it strong!

html: This week marks 5 years since #SCOTUS issued its decision in Shelby County v. Holder. Since then, many states - including NC- have enacted restrictive voting laws. Today, we had an informative panel on the state of voting rights. Watch video here: https://www.facebook.com/CongressionalBlackCaucus/videos/10156198386506066/ …pic.twitter.com/8v1V1ep8e8
